intro: Pouzolzia thailandica, commonly known as Thai pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in spring. Pouzolzia thailandica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
